DONDE ESTA EL EPISODIO 3

Es un buen juego.

An amazing addition to the Half-Life universe, Episode 2 adds some heartfelt and well thought out new experiences as well as returning to its great balancing between story and action. The only sad part is that this could potentially be our last foray into the Half-Life universe, but lets all hope! 
 
Achievement Hunters/Completionists: 
Playthroughs Required: 1 
Average time to 100%: 8 - 12 hours 
Missable Achievements: 1 
 
Again, no difficulty based achievements here so Easy mode is an option if you's like. Chapter select is also back so you can enjoy the story and return later for most achievements, a lot more collectable ones than previously but the guide section covers all of those and none require you to start from a New Game. 
 
The only one that is Missable is carrying a damn Gnome from the beginning of the game to the end, so if you're up for the challenge, the guide section has that covered as well! Just don't do what I did and carry the bugger right up until the final moments, then forget to shut the door! You'll never get that rush of your first run through with Gnomey again, believe me, you just end up resenting him if you do it more than once...

More improvements since Episode One - new interesting areas, new progress on story, new enemies, new experiences, bolder in graphics and map designs, and of course very stable performance. However, if I were to put it then HL2:EP1 > HL2:EP2 > HL2. Don't get me wrong yet, it doesn't mean EP2 is worse than EP1, it is just me simply had more fun in EP1 than EP2, for others it maybe the opposite. Besides, if I liked EP2 too much I would f*ck myself because of that cliffhanger ending, therefore I chose the EP1 one and accepted the series ended there, HL3 or not I don't care (but still... f*ck you Valve)
.
That being said, very solid gameplay. 8.5/10

Half-Life 2: Episode Two was released in 2007's five-in-one Orange Box collection alongside Portal and Team Fortress 2, marking perhaps Valve's finest moment as an honest, hard-working game developer. Whereas [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/trar/recommended/380]Episode One[/url] focused more on under-the-hood improvements and urban combat, Episode Two takes the player through expansive environments with more overt displays of the Source engine's prowess on display, although you're still partnered with Alyx through most of it. It's even a little longer than Episode One to boot.

This game, believe it or not, was actually my introduction to Half-Life and Valve's body of work. Beforehand, I was content with playing Halo 3 matchmaking for unhealthy amounts of time. I got an Xbox 360 copy of the Orange Box a couple of months after it came out, and all told it was a great experience. Episode Two is still worth playing today as a great FPS that continued to improve on what made Half-Life 2 great. From a current perspective, it stands firmly between oldschool and newschool in terms of genre-relative mechanics, with a side of driving - again, better than HL2's already enjoyable buggy section. The story, although the third entry in the series since the introduction of actual characters and their plotlines, is compelling...but if you pay more than cursory attention to the world of video games you almost certainly know the ending.

I won't reiterate what most people already know, except to say that it's an abrupt cliffhanger, and that everyone knows about it because it is an unresolved cliffhanger. To be precise, an explicit unresolved cliffhanger that Valve will never resolve themselves, because they decided to [url=https://uk.ign.com/articles/valve-explains-why-half-life-2-episode-3-was-never-made]wait until the time was right to make another technical leap forward[/url] while making mountains of money off Steam, Dota, and Counter-Strike in the meantime. The fact that 13 years later this resulted in Half-Life: Alyx, the first triple-A VR game ever, makes up for it somewhat - as is their commitment to true evolution over what they perceived as formulaic releases - but they'll never 100% make up for basically ignoring Half-Life even existed for the period of time in between.

For Valve to have almost no communication regarding the Half-Life franchise, without so much as an attempt at resolving the cliffhanger, was kind of a long-term slap in the face to its biggest fans. I know Valve wanted to have some technological advancement to show for its next Half-Life game, but all fans truly wanted in terms of an immediate sequel was a good conclusion to the story.

There is hope for that conclusion, though. There is a fan project seeking to create the lost Episode Three based off the plot outline one of Half-Life's writers released after they left the company: [url=https://www.projectborealis.com/#about]Project Borealis[/url]. While it's being made in Unreal Engine 4, seems promising - but as of now it may be a long time coming.

If you don't mind an unfinished story and want to experience a genre classic from a developer's glory days if you haven't already, I'd absolutely recommend it, though I'd also recommend playing the other Half-Life games first. Just be prepared to wait for the eventual fan-made release of what was supposed to come next.

Half-Life® 2: Episode Two is the second in a trilogy of new games created by Valve that extends the award-winning and best-selling Half-Life® adventure. As Dr. Gordon Freeman, you were last seen exiting City 17 with Alyx Vance as the Citadel erupted amidst a storm of unknown proportions.

A great continuation of Half-Life 2: Episode One. Episode Two has the same story and gameplay that made its predecessor a legend.

Я прошёл 2 эпизод и вот вывод игра конечно лутчше и чем 1 эпизод, даже в чёмто лутше чем 2 халфа. Наконец добавили свой заряд для фонаря в 1 эпизоде когда были под цитаделм его не хватало,финал сложный и эпичный новый враг первая боевая встреча с ним была такая тип смотрим а заметит нас не заметит, волнение.Гнома можно запустить в космос.Жаль что нет 3 части халфы.я ещё разговаривал с габеном на счёт халф лайф 3 и вот наш диалог.Я:мистер габен когда будет новая игра халф лайф 3?Габен:так мы делаем новую игру ток не халфлайф 3 а артифакт Я:но мистер габен фанаты же ждут халфлайф 3 Габен:так это вам же мой бывшый сотрудник рассказал вам возможный сюжет 3 части так и хватит вам на этом а мне нужны деньги Я:так у вас их много Габен: нужно ещё больше а то на что мне покупать разработчмков на создание таких денег выжималок Я:но ведь если выпустите халф лайф 3 да пусть с халф лайф можно даже и портал3 и тф3 и лэфт 3 они же окупятся Габен:сложно и я забыл сказать я не умею счмтать до 3

Jako, że przeszedłem cały dodatek myślę, że to dobry moment na aktualizację swojej recenzji. Jestem po całej serii half-life aktualnie. Spędziłem nad nią kilka wieczorów i jestem w szoku. Jest 2020 rok, a HL2 wciąż wydaje się być świeżą grą - wystarczy przymknąć oko na grafikę i naprawdę czuć klimat. W mojej galerii screenshotów możecie znaleźć screeny z mojej podróży do White Forest w towarzystwie Alyx i tego ekhm... krasnoludka. Tyle razy go zgubiłem i szukałem po całym obszarze, że raczej nie zamierzam tego powtarzać, ale wiem, że do gry na pewno będę wracał. Polecam serdecznie, nie musisz być fanem serii, żeby dobrze się bawić. 100% osiągnięć możesz uzyskać przy pierwszym podejściu, gdzie większość osiągnięć takich jak to za zabicie wszystkich Grubów trafiają się totalnie przypadkiem :) Mam nadzieję, że się doczekam kolejnej części przygód Freemana. Wiem, ile czasu minęło od premiery, ale nadzieja umiera ostatnia ^^
Great game, one of the best I've ever played in my life, oh, right, one small detail to mention, WHY WOULD YOU SET UP A SEQUAL WITH A CLIFFHANGER AND NOT MAKE ONE?!?!?!

Half Life 2: Episode 2 is much better than HL2: E1, and stands as a great game of its own. The wide open areas are in good contrast to City 17, which I feel is very cramped. This episode also has some of the best dialogue and interactions in the series, and has the best vehicle in the series. I only wish Valve had continued to make Episodes in this series.

prepare for unforseen consequences

What can I say, HL2 episode 1 was incredible, multiply that incredibleness by 10, and you get HL2 episode 2. From intense battles with hunters, to also running over the f/cks, to ventures through fabulous antlion burrows, to coming face to face with swarms of antlions as well as several larvae to trod on etc. There's so much in this miraculous episode that Valve have made for the sequel of their legendary game series. Later on, quite near the end, something was revealed that made me pause the game as to think it over and over due to how astonishing it was, I'm definitely not spoiling it. The ending is one of the most astounding cliffhangers I've ever experienced. It's a damn shame Valve haven't made a proceeding episode to it, in fact, it makes me even more demanding of HL3.
Deserves a sequel
